      float calcProbability​(int xSeparation, int ySeparation)
      given x and y separations of a pixel (presumably from its nearest neighbor), use xScale and yScale to transform those separations into the reference frame of the PDF which was constructed from scaled axes (where scaling by default was "1" unless calculation was requested and a different scale found).
      protected void calcProbabilityAndError​(int separation, float[] output)
      infer the probability and error of the given separation.
      protected void calcProbabilityAndError​(int xSeparation, int ySeparation, float[] output)  
      float getXBackgroundSeparation()
      this is in the original x axis reference frame and represents a pairwise distance representative of background, that is non-clustered, point spacing.

      this is in the original y axis reference frame and represents a pairwise distance representative of background, that is non-clustered, point spacing.

    • Field Detail

      • scales

        protected int[] scales
        The PDF was created using the scaled axes. scales holds the scale factors for that and they can be used on variables in the original reference frame (= not scaled) to transform to the reference frame of the PDF. They are each "1" by default. The first dimension is for the x axis and the 2nd is for the y axis.

      • bckGndSep

        protected float[] bckGndSep
        The x separation and y separation in the original reference frame that are used to define the critical separation for association of 2 points

      • dists

        protected float[] dists
        the x axis of the PDF

      • counts

        protected float[] counts
        These are the normalized counts of the dists

      • errs

        protected float[] errs
        the errors for the points in (threeSs, threeSCounts)

      • getXBackgroundSeparation

        public float getXBackgroundSeparation()
        this is in the original x axis reference frame and represents a pairwise distance representative of background, that is non-clustered, point spacing. 
                bckGndSep[0]/scales[0] puts the field into the reference frame of the PDF
        Returns:

      • getYBackgroundSeparation

        public float getYBackgroundSeparation()
        this is in the original y axis reference frame and represents a pairwise distance representative of background, that is non-clustered, point spacing.
        Returns:

      • setAndNormalizeCounts

        protected void setAndNormalizeCounts​(float[] counts)
        normalize the counts and set them internally. has side effect of calculating the errors too.
        Parameters:
        counts -

      • calcProbability

        public float calcProbability​(int xSeparation,
                             int ySeparation)
        given x and y separations of a pixel (presumably from its nearest neighbor), use xScale and yScale to transform those separations into the reference frame of the PDF which was constructed from scaled axes (where scaling by default was "1" unless calculation was requested and a different scale found).
        Parameters:
        xSeparation -
        ySeparation -
        Returns:

      • calcProbabilityAndError

        protected void calcProbabilityAndError​(int xSeparation,
                                       int ySeparation,
                                       float[] output)

      • calcProbabilityAndError

        protected void calcProbabilityAndError​(int separation,
                                       float[] output)
        infer the probability and error of the given separation. NOTE that the separation must be in the reference frame of the scaled data.
        Parameters:
        separation - in scaled reference frame
        output - resulting probability and error

                float separation,
